abstract: About 50 million Americans are enrolled in high-deductible employer health care plans, having decided huge savings in premiums outweighs risk of potentially paying thousands of dollars for medical costs; benefits consultants say many people do not understand subtleties of health care options and may choose high-premium, low-deductible plan--or vice versa--when other type would make more sense.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: More people are choosing to pay less in monthly premiums, leaving them responsible for high medical costs later.
snippet: More people are choosing to pay less in monthly premiums, leaving them responsible for high medical costs later....

headline.main: Is High-Deductible Health Insurance Worth the Risk?
headline.print_headline: Higher Deductible for a Lower Premium. But Is It Worth the Risk?
